body.prompt:
Generate a fake conversation between a customer and an agent.
The agent should introduce themselves, their company and give the customer
their name. The agent should ask for the customer's name.
As part of the conversation, have the agent ask for two pieces of
personal information. As part of the conversation, the customer should ask two questions.  Spell out numbers. For example, 1000 should be
said as one zero zero zero, not one thousand. The conversation should cover two or three topics, have back and forth between the parties, and be complete. At the end
of the conversation, the agent should thank the customer for their time
and end the conversation. Return the conversation formatted 
like the following example:

{'conversation': 
    [
    {'speaker': 'Agent', 'message': 'xxxxx'}, 
    {'speaker': 'Customer', 'message': "xxxxx."}, 
    {'speaker': 'Agent', 'message': "xxxxxx"}
    ] 
}

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Hello, thank you for contacting BrightLife Insurance. My name is Harold Wood. May I have your name, please?

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Great to meet you, Melissa. Could you please provide your date of birth and zip code for verification purposes?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: Sure. My date of birth is the fifteenth of March, nineteen eighty-five, and my zip code is nine zero four seven five.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Thank you for that information, Melissa. Do you have any questions about our insurance policies or services?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: Yes. How long does it usually take to process a return?

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Our return process usually takes seven to ten business days once we receive the returned item. Is there anything else you'd like to know?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: Could you tell me more about your coverage options for home insurance?

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Of course, Melissa. We offer different coverage options tailored to your needs. I will provide you with detailed information. Thank you for your time, Melissa. If you have any further questions, feel free to reach out.
